events.title: End of the Crimean War
events.description: The Treaty of Paris was signed, ending the Crimean War. The treaty neutralized the Black Sea and resolved territorial disputes between Russia and the Ottoman Empire.
events.significance: This treaty shifted the balance of power in Europe and marked a significant moment in 19th century diplomacy.

events.title: Assassination attempt on Ronald Reagan
events.description: President Ronald Reagan survived an assassination attempt by John Hinckley Jr. outside a Washington D.C. hotel. Reagan was shot but recovered quickly.
events.significance: The event highlighted issues of presidential security and mental health awareness in the US.

events.title: Launch of Pioneer 10 spacecraft
events.description: NASA launched Pioneer 10, the first spacecraft to travel through the asteroid belt and make a direct passage through the outer solar system.
events.significance: Pioneer 10 provided humanityâ€™s first close-up images of Jupiter and opened the era of deep space exploration.

events.title: Spanish Civil War ends
events.description: Madrid fell to Francisco Franco's troops, marking the conclusion of the Spanish Civil War.
events.significance: This event led to the establishment of Franco's dictatorship in Spain, impacting European politics for decades.

events.title: Croatia declares independence
events.description: Croatia formally declared independence from Yugoslavia, escalating conflicts that led to the Croatian War of Independence.
events.significance: This declaration was a key moment in the breakup of Yugoslavia and the reshaping of Eastern Europe.
